result.execSummary:
The defendant Licela Perez Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Licela Perez Hernandez
Current: 2903 Russet St, Racine, WI 53405   (Effective: 03-02-2016)
Prior: 5635 Byrd Ave Apt 6, Racine, WI 53406

Defendant Licela Perez Hernandez in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Michael Patrick White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Daniel Lopez, appeared on behalf of the defendant. Court Reporter:  Katie Giebel.
Deft has not attended CCV.
Deft has the money saved to take the class.
BTC: Deft to attend CCV on 2/20/16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***12-16-15 MODIFY CONDITIONS OF BOND TO ALLOW NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH THE VICTIMS JAP, AP AND YP.***  No contact with the victims, JAP, AP and YP (person, property, residence or family). A third party must be used to pick up any personal belongings.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Licela Perez Hernandez in court with attorney Domingo S. Cruz.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter, Susan Schweigert, appeared on behalf of the defendant.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
State has extended an offer.
Def has filed a Motion to modify bond to have no violent contact with the victim.
State would like the Court to speak with the victim first.
The victim would like the charges dropped.
Parties are to engage in Counseling together.
State will not object to the bond being modified today for reasons stated on the record.
Deft will attend CCV.
BTC: Motion to modify conditions of bond granted, modify bond to allow no violent contact with the victims, Deft to attend CCV on 1-30-16.  Status conference scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Pre-trial conference at 11-19-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 12-16-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victims, JAP, AP and YP (person, property, residence or family). A third party must be used to pick up any personal belongings.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Licela Perez Hernandez in court with attorney Anne Cohen.  Defendant Licela Perez Hernandez in custody.  Thomas Jerome Coaty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. Interpreter, Brenda Bartholomew, appears for the Defendant.   Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Licela Perez Hernandez in court with attorney Gregory Austin Holdahl.  Defendant Licela Perez Hernandez in custody.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
Defense notifies the Court that the Defendant is in need of an interpreter. 
BTC: Matter is adjourned.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
